page.title: 07Farming - Continued
page.content: Ion Farm- Gravenhurst This farm was originally part of the Wrest Park Estate, and is worked together with Fielden Farm, Gravenhurst and Top Farm, Streatley. Ion Farm and Fielden farm consist of both old and new buildings. The old buildings were erected in the l9th century from local bricks which were probably made from clay dug out of the pit in the village and fired in the Kiln and Lower Gravenhurst. The modern buildings have been erected during the last 25 years and are purpose built and made of steel, concrete and asbestos. The farming enterprises are dairy, beef production and arable.the farms together total 5l5 ha. (about l200 acres) most of which grows crops, wheat barley and oilseed rape. There is about 70ha of grassland for the dairy cattle and 8ha. of a plantation
